Vocabularies.Definition: (使)成为现实
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her dream of being a college student has turned into a reality.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a car 汽车
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  An automobile usually has four wheels and an internal-combustion engine, used for land transport.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. producing much money; profitable 生利的，赚钱的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Many ex-army officers have found lucrative jobs in private security firms.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  (esp US) now; in a short time, soon 现在，目前；不久
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We presently have no plans to expand our business overseas, but that may well change in the future.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  (AmE) 万亿，1012；(BrE) 百万兆，1018
n.  制造业 a.	制造业的，制造的 manufacture vt.  make (goods) on a large scale using machinery  （大量）制造
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Britain now manufactures approximately 40 per cent of Europe's desktop computers.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   make (sth.) change completely or in a dramatic way  彻底改革，使发生革命性剧变
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Computers have revolutionized banking.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   传感器；探测设备
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A sensor is a device that converts measurable elements of a physical process into data meaningful to the computer.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.   more or less exactly; about近似；大概 approximate a.    fairly correct or accurate but not completely so 近似的；大概的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Approximately $150 million is to be spent on improvements on school buildings.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   (fml) a death caused by accident or in war, etc. （事故或战争等造成的）死亡
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Britain has thousands of road fatalities every year.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.     remove  (sb./sth.) that is not wanted or needed; get rid of 消除；消灭；排除
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The Chinese government approved a new plan to eliminate illiteracy nationwide by 2006.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    酒精，乙醇
n.    汽；雾；蒸汽 e.g.  The atmosphere always contains some moisture in the form of water vapor.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: 空气中；在空中；悬而未决 e.g.  There is a peculiar smell in the air.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: begin or begin working, running, etc. 发动，启动；开始 e.g.  Peter looked in his mirror and started up the engine.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  warn (sb.) that there may be danger, trouble, etc. 使警觉，使警惕；使注意 e.g.  The manager alerted the staff to the crisis facing the company.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  雷达，无线电探测器
n. （汽车）保险杠；减震器；缓冲器
n.  车道 e.g.  The newly-built highways have two lanes for each direction of travel.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the first model or design of sth. from which other forms are copied or developed 原型；样品 e.g.  Bell uttered to his assistant the words, "Mr. Watson, come here; I want you," using a prototype telephone.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. dull and never changing or varying; constant and boring  单调的；一成不变的 e.g.  Robots are used in repetitive, monotonous tasks in which human performance might degrade over time.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.     of or producing hypnosis or a similar condition  催眠的；有催眠作用的
n.     分开物；分隔物；分配器
ad. extremely 十足；严重地 gross a.  glaringly obvious; whole; total 显而易见的；总的；毛的 e.g.  Funding of education has been grossly inadequate for years.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a thing that can be dangerous or cause damage; a danger or risk 危害；危险
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The research has confirmed that tobacco smoke presents a hazard to health.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  （汽车等的）仪表板
n.   眼睑，眼皮
a.  (usu derog) not regular or even in movement, quality or behavior; not reliable 不规则的，无常的；不可靠的
be unable to move or to be moved 停留，被阻塞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I was stuck in the traffic yesterday for about one hour. That's why I missed the plane.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   卫星
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Engineers have developed many kinds of satellites, each designed to serve a specific purpose or mission.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. (cause to) move rapidly and continuously backwards and forwards; shake（使）振动，颤动，摇摆
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Microwave ovens operate by agitating the water molecules in the food, causing them to vibrate, which produces heat.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   频率；次数；重复发生率
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Fatal road accidents have decreased in frequency over recent years.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  量子
transmit (a signal, etc.) by radio waves, etc.; send from a central point 用（无线电波等）发送（信号等）；发送
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The yacht sent out a distress signal which was picked up by a passing steamer.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   (cause to) change from one form or use to another （使）转变，（使）改变
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Solar cooking requires a dark pot to absorb the sun's rays and convert them into heat energy.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 导航的，领航的
n.  the ability or power to do sth. 能力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  These tests are beyond the capability of an average 12-year-old.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   bring (sth.) into a mutual relationship (with another)使(与…)相互关联
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A mother's smoking in pregnancy correlates with low birth weight in her baby.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 旋转，转动 rotate  v.  move or make (sth.) move in circles around a central point（使）旋转，（使）转动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Earth completes 366 rotations about its axis in every leap year.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   微芯片，微晶片
ad.   极端地；激烈地，猛力地 drastic  a.  having a strong or violent effect 极端的；激烈的，猛力的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Services have been drastically reduced.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the action or an instance of putting a theory, discovery, etc. to practical use 应用；运用
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Multimedia applications usually require more computer memory and processing power.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  使做好准备 be poised to (do) be ready to take action at any moment 做好准备随时（做…）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The automobile company is poised to launch its new advertising campaign.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  徒步旅行者
n.    the branch of information technology which deals with the long-distance transmission of computerized information 远程信息学
n.  公路；交通干线
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Traffic along major highways in some cities is monitored by remote cameras, radar, or sensors in the roadway.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  fix (sth.) in position for use, display or study; put (sth.) into place on a support 将…固定住；将…置于架上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Some automobiles were designed with a transmission mounted on the rear axle.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   device or equipment for transmitting radio or other electronic signals 发射机；发报机
n.    a thing that is in the way of sb./sth. 障碍物 obstruct  v.  be or get in the way of (sb./sth.); block 阻碍；阻塞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  John was irritated by drivers parking near his house and causing an obstruction.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  between states, esp. in the USA （美国）州与州之间的，州际的
v.  (usu passive) use machines to do work previously done by people 使自动化
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This part of the assembly process is now fully automated.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   磁的；有磁性的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Rubber is not magnetic.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  大钉；道钉
控制
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The new manager didn't know how to take control of his company.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  travel over 在…上通行
v.  group together 使成一束（或一捆等）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They bunched together to allow others to squeeze into the crowded elevator.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  supporter of sth. 促进者；助长者
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  an enthusiastic promoter of good causes

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  equip with computers 使计算机化
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The accounts section has been completely computerized.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make (sth.) part of a whole 将…包括进去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His newly published book incorporates his earlier essays.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a thing that is good or helpful for sb; a benefit; an advantage 特别有用的东西；好处；利益
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A bicycle is a real boon when you live in a small town.

Vocabularies.Definition: too 也，又
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She wanted to produce the play and to direct it as well.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  become or make sth. smaller or fewer  减少
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A single solar cooker can save a ton of firewood per year and decreases carbon dioxide emissions.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 污染
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  One of the greatest challenges caused by air pollution is global warming.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   扩大；扩展；发展
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Modern cosmologists are continuously calculating the age, density, and rate of expansion of the universe.
